result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loren Isreal Knox

defendant.name: Knox, Loren Isreal
defendant.address: 9025 West Howard Avenue Apt 205, Milwaukee, WI 53228

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Loren Isreal Knox.  Attorney Dax Odem in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox appears in court without counsel.  Attorney Brittany Skye Kachingwe appears in court for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Samuel Simpson.

Case in court for a calendar call.  Court vacates stayed warrant and schedules a status conference.  Defense counsel notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case recalled, no appearances.

Defendant appeared in court without counsel. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court advised Mr. Knox to appear in court on September 9, 2022 at 8:30 AM. Parties notified of next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox not in court.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense is in trial on another matter and does not appear in court.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense filed a request for substitution of Judge.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.  Court vacated final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Final pre-trial. State in receipt of additional discovery and needs to turn over to defense counsel. Parties request an adjournment of the trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case is rescheduled due to Court availability. Parties notified.
filed.
filed.
filed.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greendale Officer J. Barth.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Fred Richardson; filed.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hype Boys With The Toys, its owners (KM, MSM, and LSM), and its employees

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Loren Isreal Knox in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Loren Isreal Knox appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
